coffees.title: Black
coffees.description: Black coffee is a very popular drink around the world, and is enjoyed by many for its strong, rich coffee infusion. It is made from the roasted and ground beans of a coffee plant, and is usually prepared with hot water. The result is a dark, intense drink with a distinctive and striking flavor.

coffees.title: Cappucino
coffees.description: Cappuccinos are known for being creamier and less bitter than other coffee drinks, making them a popular choice for those who like a smoother taste. They are also decorated with cinnamon, cocoa powder, or other ingredients to add flavor and color.

coffees.title: Espresso
coffees.description: Espresso is a drink prepared from finely roasted and ground coffee beans, which are then pressed with hot water to produce a concentrated, strong coffee. Espresso is widely known for its thick cream and intense aroma, and is commonly served in small cups to make the most of its concentrated flavor.

coffees.title: Americano
coffees.description: It is known for being less strong and sweeter than traditional espresso, and is a popular choice for those who want a less full-bodied coffee. Americano is also a great choice for those who want to enjoy the flavor of coffee, but without the excess caffeine.

coffees.title: Latte Macchiato
coffees.description: Latte Macchiato is known for its mild sweetness and milk flavoring, making it a popular choice for those looking for a sweeter alternative to traditional coffee. In addition, the drink is often added flavors such as cinnamon, vanilla, or chocolate to enhance its flavor.

coffees.title: Mocha
coffees.description: Today, Mocha coffee is a popular drink all over the world and can be found in many cafes and restaurants. . It is a great option for those cold days or for those who want a drink with an additional chocolate flavor. In addition, Mocha coffee is also a good option for those who crave the energy of coffee, but prefer something a little sweeter and creamier.

coffees.title: Mocchiato
coffees.description: The name Mocha refers to the port of Mocha on the Ethiopian coast, a major port for coffee exports in the 18th century. The coffee is known for its creaminess and chocolate flavor, which is complemented by the strong presence of coffee.

coffees.title: Caf√© au lait
coffees.description: The name Mocha refers to the port of Mocha on the Ethiopian coast, a major port for coffee exports in the 18th century. The coffee is known for its creaminess and chocolate flavor, which is complemented by the strong presence of coffee.

coffees.title: Irish
coffees.description: Irish coffee is a classic and popular drink known for its combination of espresso, Irish cream and whiskey. It is usually served hot and is known for its unique combination of strong coffee flavors, smooth cream and the touch of whiskey that gives it a sweet, warm taste.

coffees.title: Guayoyo
coffees.description: Guayoyo coffee is originally from Venezuela and is known for its mild acidity and chocolatey taste. It is grown in the Aragua region and is considered one of the best coffees in Latin America. It is known for its creamy texture and intense aroma, making it a popular choice among coffee lovers.

coffees.title: Affogato
coffees.description: Affogato coffee is a traditional Italian drink that combines hot coffee and cream gelato. The word 'affogato' means 'drowned' in Italian, which refers to the act of dipping the gelato into the coffee.

coffees.title: Flat white
coffees.description: The Flat white coffee is a popular drink that originated in Australia and New Zealand. It is made from a cut espresso with creamy, dense steamed milk. The result is a drink with an even layer of milk foam on the surface, which allows the aroma of the coffee to blend perfectly with the smooth, creamy flavor of the milk.

coffees.title: Frappucino
coffees.description: Frappuccino has become a popular choice for anyone who wants to enjoy a sweet, iced coffee drink, especially on hot summer days. It is served in large cups with lids and straws, making it a practical option for taking on the go.

coffees.title: Cortado
coffees.description: This drink is popular in Spain and many Latin American countries, where it is often served as part of breakfast or as a snack during the day. Cut coffee is an ideal option for those who like the taste of espresso, but prefer a milder drink than plain coffee.

coffees.title: Ristretto
coffees.description: Ristretto coffee is a strong, concentrated espresso beverage that originated in Italy. The name Ristretto means 'restricted' or 'limited' in Italian, which refers to the fact that less water is used in the extraction of the coffee compared to a traditional espresso.

coffees.title: Bulletproof Coffee
coffees.description: The idea behind Bulletproof Coffee is that by adding healthy fat to the drink, it can help increase energy, improve concentration, and increase satiety. The butter used in the drink is usually unsalted, organic butter from grass-fed cows, and coconut oil or MCT is added to provide medium-chain fatty acids.

coffees.title: Vienna Coffee
coffees.description: Vienna Coffee is a coffee-based drink that originated in Vienna, Austria, in the 19th century. It is made with espresso coffee and whipped cream, usually served in a glass coffee cup so that the layers of the drink can be appreciated.

coffees.title: Red Eye
coffees.description: Red Eye Coffee is a popular drink among coffee lovers who need an extra dose of caffeine to stay alert during the day. It is made with a shot of espresso and a cup of regular coffee. The name 'Red Eye' is believed to be a reference to the red appearance of the eyes of those who stay up all night, but it may also be an allusion to the stimulating effect the drink has on the body and mind.

coffees.title: Turkish Coffee
coffees.description: Turkish coffee is known for its strong, aromatic flavor, which is accentuated by the addition of sugar. It is a drink that can be enjoyed alone or accompanied by sweets and desserts, such as baklava or lokum (also known as 'Turkish delight'). Turkish coffee is more than just a drink - it is an important aspect of Turkish culture and is often served during social gatherings, wedding ceremonies and other important celebrations. It is a drink that brings people together and creates a sense of community around the act of sharing a cup of coffee.
